title: Gesture-Based Navigation
description: Implementing iOS-like gesture navigation patterns in Flutter for seamless user experience.
motivation: iOS users expect swipe-back gestures to work flawlessly. Flutter's default back gesture feels clunky compared to native iOS. I wanted to recreate that seamless, physics-based navigation experience.

approach.description: Analyzed iOS navigation behavior frame by frame, then recreated the physics and visual cues in Flutter.

steps.title: Behavior Analysis
steps.description: Recorded and analyzed iOS navigation gestures to understand the physics curves and thresholds.

steps.title: Custom PageRoute
steps.description: Built a custom PageRoute with gesture detection and interactive transitions.

steps.title: Physics Tuning
steps.description: Implemented spring physics with carefully tuned damping and stiffness values.

steps.title: Edge Cases
steps.description: Handled nested navigators, modal sheets, and conflicting horizontal scrollviews.

worked: Spring physics with 0.7 damping ratio feels most natural
Shadow and scale effects add to the premium feel
didntWork: Gesture arena conflicts with horizontal scrollviews needed careful handling
Hero animations required special coordination with gesture state

keyInsights.title: Details Matter
keyInsights.description: The difference between 'good enough' and 'great' is in subtle physics and visual feedback.

keyInsights.title: Platform Expectations
keyInsights.description: Users have muscle memory from their platform — respect it or frustrate them.

keyInsights.title: Test on Real Devices
keyInsights.description: Gesture performance varies significantly between emulators and real hardware.
